Finally, we return to the original motivation of this work, namely the ML-aided exploration of complex reaction networks. To illustrate the use of ML-predicted REs, we consider a closed network of over 21,393 elementary reactions, containing a large variety of bond-breaking, transfer and rearrangement reactions for oxygen, carbon and hydrogen-containing molecules
22 . Note that this network is deliberately not a subset of Rad-6, although there is significant overlap (ca. 80% of the involved molecules are included in Rad-6). This is thus, at least partially, an out-of-sample application. The challenge lies in determining which of the elementary reactions are likely relevant to a chemical process of interest. As an exemplary process we consider the early stages of methane combustion
